name: hyperviscosity

a condition in which the blood is extremely viscous (= thick and sticky): Some symptoms are related to hyperviscosity, and respond immediately to reduction of cell counts. Blood viscosity should be measured if the patient has signs or symptoms of hyper-viscosity syndrome. Related word
viscosity
More examplesFewer examplesPlasma exchange is indicated for acute treatment of symptomatic hyperviscosity.Patients with sickle cell disease are at risk of hyperviscosity if the haemoglobin is raised significantly above the patient’s normal baseline without a reduction in the proportion of sickle cells.
